Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.cache

Interface NumberArray<N extends NumberArray<N>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, MemoryStatsVisitor.Visitable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ByteArray, IntArray, LongArray
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseNumberArray, DynamicByteArray, DynamicIntArray, DynamicLongArray, DynamicNumberArray, HeapByteArray, HeapIntArray, HeapLongArray, HeapNumberArray, OffHeapByteArray, OffHeapIntArray, OffHeapLongArray, OffHeapNumberArray, OffHeapRegularNumberArray, PageCacheByteArray, PageCacheIntArray, PageCacheLongArray, PageCacheNumberArray
    public interface NumberArray<N extends NumberArray<N>>
extends MemoryStatsVisitor.Visitable, AutoCloseable
    Abstraction over primitive arrays.
    See Also:
    NumberArrayFactory

    • Method Detail

      • length

        long length()
        Returns:
        length of the array, i.e. the capacity.

      • swap

        void swap​(long fromIndex,
          long toIndex)
        Swaps items from fromIndex to toIndex, such that fromIndex and toIndex, fromIndex+1 and toIndex a.s.o swaps places. The number of items swapped is equal to the length of the default value of the array.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - where to start swapping from.
        toIndex - where to start swapping to.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Sets all values to a default value.

      • close

        void close()
        Releases any resources that GC won't release automatically.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • at

        N at​(long index)
        Part of the nature of NumberArray is that length() can be dynamically growing. For that to work some implementations (those coming from e.g NumberArrayFactory.newDynamicIntArray(long, int, org.neo4j.memory.MemoryTracker) and such dynamic calls) has an indirection, one that is a bit costly when comparing to raw array access. In scenarios where there will be two or more access to the same index in the array it will be more efficient to resolve this indirection once and return the "raw" array for that given index so that it can be used directly in multiple calls, knowing that the returned array holds the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - index into the array which the returned array will contain.
        Returns:
        array sure to hold the given index.
